quest.name: An Art for the Living
journal: Y'mhitra is ready to depart for Azys Lla.

Y'mhitra tells you what she has learned in preparation for your journey to the research facility on Azys Lla, and informs you that Captain Wolf and his summoner squad will be providing military support. Make ready for the expedition, then rendezvous with your companions at Helix.

You join Y'mhitra and the others on Azys Lla, and the scholar urges you to begin the search for a control panel of some kind. Head towards your assigned area near the statues of the Warring Triad, and seek out a research facility terminal.
You approach a promising control panel only to find yourself set upon by a trio of clockwork soldiers. After defeating your ambushers, you once more stretch forth a hand to operate the terminal...

Your efforts at the terminal are rewarded by the appearance of Sari, who then proceeds to lay his challenge at your feet. Your companions arrive in time to witness the exchange, and Y'mhitra suggests that the “clone” is, in fact, some manner of summoned entity. Her observation seems supported by the evidence at hand, but gives rise to yet another question: who, then, is the summoner? Prepare yourself to face the formidable egi, then speak with Captain Wolf when you are ready to enter the facility.

After a shocking revelation, you discover that the strings of the Sari-egi were being pulled by a sentient machine─an invention of Sari's which describes itself as an “evocation matrix.” All attempts to reason with the warped intelligence fail, and you and your companions are drawn into a battle of surreal proportions. Despite the bewildering capabilities of your opponent, however, you seize victory over the mechanical summoner. Join Y'mhitra by the statues of the Warring Triad, and discuss the aftermath of the battle.

With the evocation matrix destroyed, you have removed the final barrier to learning the secrets held within Principia's pages. Say your farewells to the summoning squad, and return to Gridania with Y'mhitra.

Upon your return, Captain Wolf shares the results of his last-moment investigation. He reports that he salvaged a number of soul crystals from the wreckage of the machine, as well as an accompanying record which explains the master summoner's descent into a bitter pessimism. You muse over Sari's disparate attempts to bequeath summoning to future generations, and the philosophical differences evident in the construction of Principia and the evocation matrix. The familiar itself seems satisfied to have entrusted you with its creator's knowledge, and content to leave the succession of summoning magic in your capable hands. Principia returns to its slumber, its purpose fulfilled...for now.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”
※ You must have completed the role quest “A Tearful Reunion.”
objectives: Search for a research facility terminal.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: This simulacrum of Master Sari has sought to obstruct my creator's will, and I shall offer it no quarter. You deserve to learn the wisdom within my pages!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I've learned all there is to be learned about the research facility. The time has come to make our move!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: From what my sister and her colleagues have told me, the laboratories are housed in an extremely dangerous quadrant of Azys Lla. We'll not want to wander around inviting trouble, but rather plot the swiftest and safest route to our destination.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: There should be a terminal somewhere that will allow us to pinpoint the section where Sari's research is being stored. Once we arrive on Azys Lla, finding such a terminal will be our highest priority.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ah, I've informed Captain Wolf of our forthcoming expedition─he insisted that he and his summoner squad provide us with support. Let us make ready and meet them at Helix.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Have these ruins truly existed for thousands of years? It's all so bright and sharp...

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: There are beasts from my worst nightmare simply strolling around up here. Prin tells me they would have been contained in the days when the Allagans yet worked at this facility.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Everywhere I turn there's a new wonder. I've pinched myself ten times already just to be sure I was awake...

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: So, this is what ye get when ye fuse the arcane with the mechanical, an' neither is diminished by the result.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Azys Lla...
Sari could hardly have chosen a more distant place to take refuge.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: The name of Azys Lla is known to me. Its facilities were constructed by the oppressors in the military, however, so I was never welcomed there...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Azys Lla is even more fantastical than I'd imagined...
But we mustn't let ourselves be distracted by the scenery! We should fan out and search for a control panel of some description.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: And we can use that to plan the simplest route to our objective, yes?

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Aye, then we plunge ahead, swift an' sure, an' bring an end to this bastard clone!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: That is my intention. 'Tis important to note, however, that we have yet to determine if our enemy is truly a clone or not.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Even an artificial copy would appear as a living, breathing being. The man you fought on Seal Rock seemed almost...otherworldly.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I'm inclined to agree with you, Y'mhitra. But no matter what he is, we need to slay him to lift Prin's seal. The job remains the same.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: True enough. Then we should first focus on finding that terminal. Forename, if you would, pray search around the base of the Warring Triad statues.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Keep your guard up─if Sari knows we're coming, he may have prepared a welcome!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Unauthorized access detected.

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Initiating countermeasures.

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Target acquired.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: I predicted you would be the first to find me. A lesser summoner would have been slain...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Forename!

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Sari's clone! It's here!

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: ...Clone? Ah, you seek to explain my existence.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: An understandable theory, but I am far more than one of those clumsy creations. You had best abandon this flawed perception, lest it lead you down the path to failure.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: I shall await you inside, potential. You will pass my test─your true final challenge─or you will die never knowing what I truly am.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Thal's teeth! He's gone again!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Did you see that, Forename!? The way he vanished? 'Tis akin to the dismissal of a summoned entity!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: So yer sayin' he's some sort of egi? One what's wearin' Sari's face? But how can he look so solid an'...well, alive?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: With the aid of a computational machine, it would be theoretically possible to reconstruct aether into a near-perfect replica of Sari's corporeal form.

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: He was summoned using a machine...?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Correct. Master Sari's research developed mechanical substitutes for grimoires. In fact, the lieutenant is standing right in front of one.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: ...This thing, eh? It looks a bit like them tomeliths on Seal Rock, only they was much bigger... Gods, can the bugger pop up anywhere there's one of these devices!?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Aye. I think we can now safely assume that this Sari is the product of enhanced summoning magic.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: But our answer leaves us with yet another question: if Sari is the “egi,” then who is the summoner? Even if the grimoire is replaced by a machine, there must still exist the one who commands it.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: We've got to find the master then. If we don't squash the summoner, the bastard'll just bring the Sari-egi back again an' again' an' again...

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Whomever the “bastard” may be, he or she must be concealed somewhere nearby. An entity will always be summoned within a certain distance of the summoner─even machine-enhanced techniques cannot circumvent this basic principle.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: That our antagonist chose not to make an appearance on Seal Rock suggests a reluctance to expose oneself to direct harm. In this location, however, with so many computational devices near to hand, I expect the foe's art will be significantly bolstered.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: So the egi will be even stronger than last time? All the more reason to take down this summoner quickly before we're swamped by aetherial horrors.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Well, I've brought a little device that should help─an aetherometer I borrowed from my sister, Shtola. If I can detect the right currents, it should lead us straight to our hidden enemy.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Excellent, Y'mhitra. That may make all the difference. Right, let's be about this, then! Summoner squad! Take the van and clear the way forward.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Aye, we've been waitin' for the chance to prove ourselves. Ye just focus on findin' the summoner, an' we'll sweep aside the dregs!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The summoner squad will see to it that we have a clear path through the facility. Let us move swiftly, and repay their dedication with a resounding victory!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Go forth and defeat this impostor, MistressMaster. The wisdom of my creator belongs to you...

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: We've not been idle since that last debacle, misssir. I'm eager to show you the results of our training.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Well, you couldn't ask for a more dramatic locale for a final confrontation. Assuming we survive all this, we'll sure have a tale to tell our barracks-mates!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Whatever support ye need, misssir, we're here to give it. We'll not leave till ye've busted that summoner's head an' got the rewards ye damn well deserve!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Ready for round two, Forename? The terminal has provided us with a direct route to the research storage chamber. We're going to rip through this facility and take Sari's clone apart!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: It is an aetherial entity, Captain Wolf, not a clone. And I must point out that your true objective is the summoner, rather than the servant.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Right, right, I knew that! As we planned, then! Summoner squad front and center─carve Forename a path through!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Aye, Captain.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Y'mhitra, you're in charge of finding whoever's pulling this impostor Sari's strings. Let's go!

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: Wonderful. You've done well to make it this far.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: The summoner has to be around here somewhere. Y'mhitra, use your gadget─I'll buy you some time.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: We came here to remove the seal you put on Principia. Do as we ask, and this can all end peacefully.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, “Captain.” I'm afraid I can't do that. To do so would run contrary to the purpose for which I was created.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: Surely by now you have come to realize my true nature?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: You are an egi in the form of my creator─an existence made possible through a fusion of summoning magic and aetherochemical technology.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: But while Master Sari was the last of the great summoners of Allag, you are naught more than an elaborate imitation. And you are no match for the summoner who now stands before you!

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: Very good, but your conjecture has missed the mark. What I am is a defense mechanism that is capable of self-enhancement in order to combat ever greater threats.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: Shall I phrase this in simple terms? In the event that I encounter a presence with greater potential than Sari, I am compelled to harness that potential through main force, and compose its aether into a new guardian entity.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: You mean to kill Forename and make an egi of the Warrior of Light!?

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: Have we reached an understanding? A peaceable conclusion to this encounter was never forthcoming.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: His reasoning has broken down. Your deeds have saved countless lives, and will continue to do so. How can one justify killing you, MistressMaster, when you embody the very principles for which summoning magic was invented?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Y'mhitra! Any luck finding that summoner!?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
I've just finished tracing the threads...
The camouflage is impressive, but I am still shocked that we missed something of that size.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Our true enemy...is up there!

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: How observant of you. You have uncovered master summoner Sari's greatest masterpiece: an artificially sentient evocation matrix.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: The complexity of my design simply cannot be compared to the primitive principles used in Principia's construction.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: Your defeat is inevitable.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Tough talk for an aging machine whose logic channels have obviously rusted with disuse! MistressMaster, might you and your companions dispose of this unsightly and unseemly amalgamation of refuse?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Three at once...
Stay focused! We can afford no missteps!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
There'll be no false steps from us!
Isn't that right, Forename?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Potential confirmed as priority target for aetherial reconstitution. Evocation reinitialized.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
Thal's teeth, more of the damn things!?
Where does it end?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Steel yourself, MistressMaster!
The machine means to overwhelm you!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Your combined strength is...unexpected.
Accessing security systems...reviving bioweapon.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Sari's speech─it's become stilted!
It strains to maintain the charade!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
<buzz> Alert! Alert!
System overload detected. Deploying advanced security measures.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
Uh, I think we made it angry...
But that must mean we're winning!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
<buzz> Exterminate hostile entities!
Ex... Ex... Exterminate!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
The system has recognized you as a legitimate threat.
Its primary directive is overridden! It means to destroy you by any means!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
<buzz> <buzz> <beeeeeep>
Exter... <buzz> ...minate...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
The machine is out of control!
One last push, MistressMaster, and victory will be yours!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
What in the seventh hell!
We can't fight all of them!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ignore the Sari-egi! Destroy the machine!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Reinitializing assessment... Analysis failed...
Retry... Analysis failed... Unexpected error...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We did it, Forename! We won!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
I never doubted you, MistressMaster.
May I suggest we now exit this unpleasant place?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: But I've fought...primals...ugh...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename...

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: An inspiring triumph, MistressMaster! Your coordination with Lady Y'mhitra and Captain Wolf was truly a thing of beauty!

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: I wish I could have seen your victory firsthand. As things stood, we were far too busy keeping the rest of the facility's hostiles at bay...

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Congratulations, misssir! Never in my wildest dreams did I imagine a thinking machine would be the villain behind all this chaos.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text:
So a machine built by Sari was summonin' an egi what looked like Sari...
Them Allagans didn't see much use for the line betwixt idea an' reality, did they?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Oh...hello. We were not to meet by the Warring Triad statues? I shall be there─I promise!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: MistressMaster? I thought you were on Azys Lla...? Now that I mention it, I thought I was on Azys Lla...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: A stunning victory, Forename! We've won the day, but Captain Wolf wished to stay behind and conduct a thorough search. I told him it was still too dangerous to wander around alone, but...

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: ...But the captain is a stubborn man. Not to worry, though─if aught should happen, we'll soon charge off to fight at his side.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Captain Wolf will call if he needs us, aye. We should be celebrating here! Does this not mean Prin's seal is now broken!?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: MistressMaster's success is indeed something to be celebrated. I was not crafted to experience emotion, but I do feel a certain rustle of satisfaction in my pages...

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Once ye've mastered them high-an'-mighty techniques, ye'll be stronger than ever... Well, I think I'd rather learn by yer example anyway, instead o' from musty scrolls written by some long-dead Allagan summoner!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: It is in the hopes of achieving just such an outcome that I awoke from my slumber. “The art of summoning is for the living,” as my creator was once so fond of declaring.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Forename, Prin, let us say our farewells for the moment. Thank you for your aid, everyone─we could not have done this without you!

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: We will wait here for the captain. As much as I would've liked to assist you in the main battle, I am proud that we contributed to your success.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text:
So a machine was using machines to summon egi...
Can you even call that magic anymore? Or is it just another form of technology...?

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Don't get lazy with yer summonin', now! The next time we meet, I mean to be yer equal in the art!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I completed a thorough investigation of the research facility before I left. My findings were worth the time and the danger, I think!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Welcome back, MistressMaster. It is almost “that time”...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename! You were only meant to face three challenges, and we ended up chasing your prize into the heavens themselves.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: An unexpected development which you handled with exceptional grace, MistressMaster. And now, at long last, I can finally bequeath to you the highest secrets of summoning! Pray step forward!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: What a momentous occasion! The wisdom of the last of Allag's master summoners is yours!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ere you depart to explore your newfound powers, however, Captain Wolf has a report for us. It should explain much of what occurred on Azys Lla...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Aye, well I wanted to be sure that machine was truly undone, and after poking around inside it I discovered a number of soul crystals. According to Principia, they belonged to Sari's disciples.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The captain also unearthed a tomestone containing undoctored records of that age. 'Twould seem that following the murder of his students, Sari became increasingly bitter.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: He began to doubt that the future could be safely entrusted to the capricious whims of mortals. Instead he explored other methods by which new generations might be safeguarded from the threat of primals, and committed himself to aetherochemical research.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: As you may have surmised, the evocation matrix was the end result of Master Sari's toil. Drawing on its embedded soul crystals and unrivaled computational power, this terrible invention was capable of manifesting a veritable host of aetherial avatars...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Once he was satisfied with his work, Sari commanded the machine to act as civilization's mightiest guardian. And then he killed himself. His aetherial essence was absorbed, and a formidable egi was added to his invention's arsenal.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: So now you know the truth of it.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
What a price to pay to ensure that the art of summoning survived unto the morrow...
After failing to protect his disciples, I wonder if he meant to preserve their soul crystals in their stead?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Even if that were his intention, he chose the wrong way to achieve it.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Prin here is the embodiment of the hopeful ideals of Sari's younger self. The murderous machine of his latter years is the product of frustration and anger and grief.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ah, but what shall we do with the crystals? We cannot risk them falling into the hands of another villain like Tristan...

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: If you wish, I could swallow the crystals and hold them safe until another era has need of them. My enchantments would ensure that they pass only into the hands of the worthy.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Swallow...? You mean to eat them!?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Fear not, Captain: I have no digestive tract of which to speak. And now that I have instructed MistressMaster in the wisdom of Allag, this task shall be the last I perform ere I return to slumber.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Wait...so this is farewell!?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Correct. Or, mayhap more appropriately, “good night”.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: As a familiar, I was not enspelled to experience loneliness. I was, however, written with the knowledge that it is best not to draw out a parting of ways with needless sentimentality.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: No tears for you then, eh, Prin!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Summoning magic was created to combat the threat of the primals. The ideal world is one in which I need never again awaken. Wield the art well, MistressMaster.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
...Off to dreamland, just like that. I suppose Prin's purpose is served, and that's the same as happiness to a familiar.
Speaking of serving one's purpose, I think it's time I took my leave.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Aye, the tasks of the morrow beckon to us all. Let us do what we may, so that Prin might rest peacefully for many years to come!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the summoner quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the role quest “A Tearful Reunion.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra.
